00020 /**
00021 
00022 
00023  @page sdk_examples  OCTEON SDK examples overview
00024 
00025 
00026 A variety of examples are provided with the OCTEON SDK.  For further
00027 information on these examples please refer to the README.txt and source
00028 code for the example.
00029 
00030 
00031 - <b>hello:</b>
00032 Classic example showing a simple program.
00033 <a href="../../examples/hello/README.txt">README.txt</a>
00034 
00035 - <b>crypto:</b>
00036 Example showing how to use the cryptographic functions of each cnMIPS core.
00037 <a href="../../examples/crypto/README.txt">README.txt</a>
00038 
00039 - <b>application-args:</b>
00040 Example showing how to pass arguments to applications and also how to run
00041 multiple applications on multiple sets of cores.
00042 <a href="../../examples/application-args/README.txt">README.txt</a>
00043 
00044 - <b>passthrough: </b>
00045 This example demonstrates simple packet input/output by sending all received packets
00046 out the same port they came in on.
00047 <a href="../../examples/passthrough/README.txt">README.txt</a>
00048 
00049 - <b>mailbox:</b>
00050 Example showing inter-core messaging using the mailbox interrupts.
00051 <a href="../../examples/mailbox/README.txt">README.txt</a>
00052 
00053 - <b>queue:</b>
00054 This example shows a memory access efficient queue implementation.
00055 <a href="../../examples/queue/README.txt">README.txt</a>
00056 
00057 - <b>debugger:</b>
00058 Example showing how to use the simple executive debugger.
00059 <a href="../../examples/debugger/README.txt">README.txt</a>
00060 
00061 - <b>uart:</b>
00062 Example showing how to do serial IO using polling or interrupts.
00063 <a href="../../examples/uart/README.txt">README.txt</a>
00064 
00065 - <b>low-latency-mem:</b>
00066 Example showing how to access low latency memory (RLDRAM.)
00067 <a href="../../examples/low-latency-mem/README.txt">README.txt</a>
00068 
00069 - <b>zip:</b>
00070 Example showing the use of the zip compression/decompression hardware.
00071 <a href="../../examples/zip/README.txt">README.txt</a>
00072 
00073 - <b>traffic-gen:</b>
00074 Example showing the use of OCTEON as a traffic generator.
00075 <a href="../../examples/traffic-gen/README.txt">README.txt</a>
00076 
00077 - <b>named-block:</b>
00078 Example showing the use cvmx_bootmem named block allocations.
00079 <a href="../../examples/named-block/README.txt">README.txt</a>
00080 
00081 - <b>linux-filter:</b>
00082 Example showing how to pass packets between cores running linux and a
00083 simple executive application.
00084 <a href="../../examples/linux-filter/README.txt">README.txt</a>
00085 
00086 - <b>pcie-scan:</b>
00087 Example shows how to enumerates all host mode PCIe ports, and looks for
00088 all PCI/PCIe devices, include devices over bridge.
00089 <a href="../../examples/pcie-scan/README.txt">README.txt</a>
00090 
00091 - <b>hotplug-app:</b>
00092 Example shows how to use cvmx_app_hotplug APIs for registering an application 
00093 for hotplug. 
00094 <a href="../../examples/hotplug-app/README.txt">README.txt</a>
00095 
00096 - <b>power-throttle:</b>
00097 Example shows how to use cvmx_power_throttle APIs for using the OCTEON II 
00098 Power Throttling feature. 
00099 <a href="../../examples/power-throttle/README.txt">README.txt</a>
00100 
00101 - <b>adma:</b>
00102 Example demonstrating how to transfer data between OCTEON memory and Endor
00103 PHY in evb71xx OCTEON model using AXI DMA APIs.
00104 <a href="../../examples/adma/README.txt">README.txt</a>
00105 
00106 - <b>coredump:</b>
00107 Example demonstrating a coredump machanizm for simple-executive applications.
00108 
00109 - <b>otrace:</b>
00110 Example demonstrating how to use otrace feature.
00111 
00112 - <b>lmc-dump:</b>
00113 Example displays all the valid LMC CSRs for the OCTEON model the application
00114 is invoked on.
00115 */
